```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load data
elections <- read.csv("https://mac-stat.github.io/data/election_2020_county.csv")

# Check it out
head(elections)
```

:::



# Excercise 1: Qunatitative vs Quantitative Intuiition Check


# Excercise 2: Quantitative Variables


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# sets up the plotting frame (no data yet)
ggplot(elections, aes(y = repub_pct_20, x = repub_pct_16))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# "geom_point()" adds the actual data points
ggplot(elections, aes(y = repub_pct_20, x = repub_pct_16)) +
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# "(shape = n)" changes the shape (from dots to a different shape)
ggplot(elections, aes(y = repub_pct_20, x = repub_pct_16)) +
  geom_point(shape = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# "color = 'orange'" changes the color of the data points
ggplot(elections, aes(y = repub_pct_20, x = repub_pct_16)) +
  geom_point(color = "orange")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# "geom_text" adds text instead of points, and "label = state_abbr" is how the code knows what specific text to use
ggplot(elections, aes(y = repub_pct_20, x = repub_pct_16)) +
  geom_text(aes(label = state_abbr))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
